thread.title: Alyssa Milano says she will breastfeed her daughter until she is six | The
thread.title_full: Alyssa Milano says she will breastfeed her daughter until she is six | The Advertiser

author: REBECCA SULLIVAN
title: Alyssa Milano says she will breastfeed her daughter until she is six | The
text:
ACTRESS Alyssa Milano is sick of being judged for breastfeeding her children.
The 42-year-old, who is mum to Milo, 4, and Elizabella, 1, is a vocal advocate of public breastfeeding and says she’s not going to stop anytime soon.
In an interview with Entertainment Tonight , the former Charmed star spoke about the double standards between the reaction to Miley Cyrus appearing “almost naked” at the VMAs, and the response Milano receives when she posts a breastfeeding photo on Instagram.
Alyssa Milano breastfeeding her young daughter Elizabella. Photo: @milano_alyssa. Source: Instagram
“Everyone’s fine with [Miley’s] nipples being out, but if I post a picture of me breastfeeding it’s craziness,” she said.
“I think people are more comfortable sexualising breasts, than relating them to what they were made for, which is feeding another human.
“It’s crazy. But you know what? I don’t care. I’m going to keep breastfeeding, maybe even until she’s six.”
This isn’t the first time Milano, who is married to David Bugliari, has spoken out about breastfeeding.
MORE: Mums on sustained breastfeeding
Host Miley Cyrus walks the red carpet at the 2015 MTV Video Music Awards last month. Photo: Frazer Harrison. Source: Getty Images
In April, she complained on Twitter when her pre-pumped breast milk was confiscated at Heathrow Airport.
“Just took my pumped breast milk away. 10 ounces [295mL]. Gone. Not okay,” she tweeted.
“They said they would let the pumped milk through if I had the baby with me. Why would I need to pump if I had the baby with me????”
At the time, Milano said she had been “overwhelmed” by the supporting she received online after posting the tweets.
MORE: 5 things to know when you’re breastfeeding
Photo: @milano_alyssa. Source: Instagram
“I think that it just struck a chord and people ran with it,” she told People Magazine .
“I think that breastfeeding mums feel like what they do needs to be hidden, or not feel like they’re getting the appreciation that comes along with being a breastfeeding mom, and it meant something that someone was being vocal.
“When I post pictures of me breastfeeding Bella, it’s not that I’m trying to be very outspoken about breastfeeding, it’s that it’s a very special moment in my life.
“What [other people] take from that is a whole other thing. Support from not only breastfeeding mums, but mums everywhere, has been really powerful and really overwhelming,” she said.
 ‘I’ll breastfeed my daughter until she’s six’
